meanings.definition: The quality or state of being wearisome.
meanings.sent1: The wearisomeness of the task made it hard to stay focused.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't bear the wearisomeness of the long meeting.
meanings.sent3: The wearisomeness of folding laundry was only alleviated by listening to music.
meanings.sent4: The wearisomeness of the routine was like a heavy weight on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The wearisomeness of the waiting room made time slow to a crawl.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being tired or bored due to something being repetitive or dull.
meanings.sent1: She yawned, feeling the wearisomeness of the lecture setting in.
meanings.sent2: The wearisomeness of the movie plot made him doze off.
meanings.sent3: The wearisomeness of the rainy day made her wish for some excitement.
meanings.sent4: The wearisomeness of the daily commute was like a never-ending cycle.
meanings.sent5: The wearisomeness of the book's plot left her searching for something more engaging.
